page.title: 19NEW ABBEY - SEA
page.content: In the east is the estuary of the River Nith with its mud flats and dangerous quick-sands.The course of the river has changed over the years. The New Abbey Pow burn was navigable for about a mile inland to Bogue Quay until l937. Goods for the mills were landed or despatched here. Many kinds of wild-fowl winter on the shore.They are protected at Caerlaverock Bird Reserve but, sadly, they can be shot if they fly the short distance over the firth. Haaf-net fishing is done in Spring and Summer. The fishers stand in the water at ebb- or flood-tide, holding a wooden frame across their shoulders. From this frame hang nets into which the salmon will swim. The average size of fish caught is 7lb.There are also flounders,plaice,sea-trout and rock- herring.
